pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:0.5.eng: The training rule on the instruction

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ovadanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six went to the nuns’ dwelling place to instruct the nuns from the group of six.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.3.eng: Soon afterwards other nuns said to those nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.4.eng: “Come, Venerables, let’s go to the instruction.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.5.pli: “Yampi mayaṃ, ayye, gaccheyyāma ovādassa kāraṇā, ayyā chabbaggiyā idheva āgantvā amhe ovadantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.5.eng: “There’s no need. The monks from the group of six came and instructed us right here.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ na gacchissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.7.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six not go to the instruction?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ na gacchantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns didn’t do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo ovādaṃ na gacchissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.11.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six not do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā na gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun does not go to the instruction or to a formal meeting of the community, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.1.8.eng: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.1.8.comm: According to Bu Pc 69:2.1.21, “community”, saṁvāsa, refers to formal meetings of the community. The present rule would seem to refer to formal meetings where both monks and nuns are present.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.1.9.pli: Ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā na gacchissāmīti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.1.9.eng: If she thinks, “I won’t go to the instruction or to formal meetings of the community,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.2.3.eng: if she searches for a companion nun, but does not find one;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc58:2.2.8.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.5.eng: The training rule on going to the instruction

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo uposathampi na pucchanti ovādampi na yācanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns did not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.3.eng: The monks complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo uposathampi na pucchissanti ovādampi na yācissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo uposathampi na pucchanti ovādampi na yācantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns don’t do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo uposathampi na pucchissanti ovādampi na yācissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.8.eng: “How can the nuns not do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1.pli: “Anvaddhamāsaṃ bhikkhuniyā bhikkhusaṅghato dve dhammā paccāsīsitabbā—uposathapucchakañca ovādūpasaṅkamanañca. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1.eng: ‘Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction. If she lets the half-month pass, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1.comm: Kd 20:9.4.18 makes it clear how this is supposed to happen. A group of two or three nuns should approach the Sangha of monks and ask for the date of the observance day and for when to come for the instruction, if at all. The nuns are essentially finding out who is available for the instruction and when.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4.pli: dve uposathā— cātuddasiko ca pannarasiko ca.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4.eng: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “observance day (ceremony)” for uposatha, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.7.pli: “Uposathampi na pucchissāmi ovādampi na yācissāmī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.7.eng: If she thinks, “I won’t enquire about the observance day, nor ask for the instruction,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.10.eng: if she searches for a companion nun, but does not find one;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.14.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.15.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:0.5.eng: The training rule on attending on

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ārohanto nāma mahāmatto bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.2.eng: a government official called Ārohanta became a monk

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena so bhikkhu tassā bhikkhuniyā santike bhattavissaggaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.4.eng: On one occasion that monk was having his meal in the presence of that nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.5.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī tassa bhikkhuno bhuñjantassa pānīyena ca vidhūpanena ca upatiṭṭhitvā accāvadati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.5.eng: While he was eating, she attended on him with drinking water and a fan, and she flirted with him.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.6.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu taṃ bhikkhuniṃ apasādeti—

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.9.pli: “Pubbe maṃ tvaṃ evañca evañca karosi, idāni ettakaṃ na sahasī”ti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.9.eng: “Before you did such and such to me, but now you can’t even take this much.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.10.pli: pānīyathālakaṃ matthake āsumbhitvā vidhūpanena pahāraṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.10.eng: And she dropped the water vessel on its head and struck him with the fan.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.10.comm: It is not clear whether matthake, “on the head”, refers to the water vessel or the monk. I have assumed it is the latter since it seems more meaningful.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.11.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.11.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.12.eng: “How could a nun hit a monk?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.13.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī bhikkhussa pahāraṃ adāsī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.13.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī bhikkhussa pahāraṃ dassati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.16.eng: “How could a nun hit a monk?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.18.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.18.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.19.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhussa bhuñjantassa pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.19.1.eng: ‘If, when a monk is eating, a nun attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.8.eng: is eating any of the five cooked foods.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.14.eng: if she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññā pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.1.eng: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as such, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.2.pli: Upasampanne vematikā pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.2.eng: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.3.pli: Upasampanne anupasampannasaññā pānīyena vā vidhūpanena vā upatiṭṭhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.3.eng: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as such, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.4.eng: If she attends on him from beyond arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.5.eng: If she attends on him when he is eating fresh food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.6.eng: If she attends on one who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.7.eng: If he is not fully ordained, but she perceives him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.8.eng: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.9.eng: If he is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.3.eng: if she has someone else give something;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.4.eng: if she asks someone who is not fully ordained to do it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.7.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:0.5.eng: The training rule on what is growing on the lower part of the body

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.2.eng: a certain nun was alone with a man, when she had him rupture an abscess growing on the lower part of her body.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.3.pli: Atha kho so puriso taṃ bhikkhuniṃ dūsetuṃ upakkami.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.3.eng: When he tried to rape her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.5.eng: The nuns rushed up and asked her why.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.7.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.7.eng: And she told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.9.eng: “How could a nun be alone with a man and have him rupture an abscess growing on the lower part of her body?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpessati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ vā rudhitaṃ vā anapaloketvā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā purisena saddhiṃ ekenekā bhedāpeyya vā phālāpeyya vā dhovāpeyya vā ālimpāpeyya vā bandhāpeyya vā mocāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun, alone with a man, without getting permission from the Sangha or a group, has an abscess or a wound situated on the lower part of her body ruptured by him, or split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped by him, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.5.eng: The lower part of the body:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.6.eng: below the navel and above the knees.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.10.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “abscess” for gaṇḍa, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.16.eng: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.18.eng: several nuns is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.20.pli: manussapuriso, na yakkho, na peto, na tiracchānagato, viññū paṭibalo dūsetuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.20.eng: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of raping.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.24.eng: just the man and the nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.25.eng: If she tells him, “Rupture it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.26.eng: When it has been ruptured, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.27.eng: If she tells him, “Split it open,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.28.eng: When it has been split open, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.29.eng: If she tells him, “Wash it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.30.eng: When it has been washed, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.31.eng: If she tells him, “Anoint it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.32.eng: When it has been anointed, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.33.eng: If she tells him, “Bandage it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.34.eng: When it has been bandaged, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.35.eng: If she tells him, “Unwrap it,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.1.36.eng: When it has been unwrapped, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.2.pli: apaloketvā bhedāpeti vā phālāpeti vā dhovāpeti vā ālimpāpeti vā bandhāpeti vā mocāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.2.eng: if she gets permission and then has it ruptured, split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.3.eng: if she has a female companion who understands;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.6.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc60:2.2.7.eng: The sixth subchapter on monasteries is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:0.5.eng: The training rule on pregnant women

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo gabbhiniṃ vuṭṭhāpenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.2.eng: the nuns gave the full admission to a pregnant woman.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.5.eng: “Give almsfood to the Venerable. She’s carrying a heavy burden.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns give the full admission to a pregnant woman?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.8.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.8.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.9.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.9.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo gabbhiniṃ vuṭṭhāpessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.16.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a nun gives the full admission to a pregnant woman, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.6.eng: a woman with child is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.9.pli: “Vuṭṭhāpessāmī”ti gaṇaṃ vā ācariniṃ vā pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā pariyesati, sīmaṃ vā sammannati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.9.eng: If, intending to give the full admission, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a monastery zone, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.9.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “monastery zone” for sīmā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.10.eng: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.10.comm: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.11.eng: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.12.eng: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.13.pli: Gaṇassa ca ācariniyā ca āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.1.13.eng: and the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.1.eng: If the woman is pregnant, and the nun perceives her as such, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.2.eng: If the woman is pregnant, but the nun is unsure of it, yet she gives her the full admission, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.3.eng: If the woman is pregnant, but the nun does not perceive her as such, and she gives her the full admission, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.4.eng: If the woman is not pregnant, but the nun perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.5.eng: If the woman is not pregnant, but the nun is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.2.6.eng: If the woman is not pregnant, and the nun does not perceive her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.2.eng: if she gives the full admission to a woman who is pregnant, but she  does not perceive her as such;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.3.eng: if she gives the full admission to a woman who is not pregnant, and she does not perceive her as such;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc61:2.3.6.eng: The first training rule is finished.
